title: Is it true that the retirement home at Castle and South Front Street has recently been sold - supposedly to be torn down or \'converted\'?
text:
Yes, the Solomon Towers -- low-income housing units near downtown --
were sold to the Caper Corporation, which hopes to turn them into
condos. The property was sold for $13 million.

Of course, with the economy the way it is, that may take some time
and until then the residents have not been pushed out but many are in
the process of find a new place to live.
